dialogue.text: The stars sink into the sea sometime after the sky goes to sleep.
It’s silent.
But I find solace in the sensation of sand on the soles of my shoes.
And while the slight semblance of my soul slips into the surface, it still seems as if a siren song is summoning me forward.
So I go.
I go. I go. I go. I go. I go.
But where?
And when did the sun set?
{i}Why{/i} did the sun set?
And who is the siren?
I press my hands together and glance down to see my fingers interlocking with one another, emulating the sensation of something I have not felt in quite some time.
Even those I am closer with than I am to my own reflection mean nothing when there is a complete lack of understanding.
And if there is anything I understand, it’s that.
Everything else is ephemeral.
It’s gone just as quickly as it appears.
Whether it be a night sky or a trip to a beach, it all fades into nothingness and leaves a trail of destruction clinging to life behind it as it goes.
It goes. It goes. It goes. It goes. It goes.
But where?
And when did I become someone whose silhouette does not attach itself to the shoreline?
No shadow on the ground nor reflection in the water.
Typical.
I replace “ephemeral” with “ethereal” in my head and let the winter air, laced with water droplets from waves I can’t even see, jump onto my skin and my shirt.
It somehow makes me feel a little less lonely.
I don’t even remember how I got here.
Or when I got here.
I’m assuming this means I zoned out again but, apparently, was not fortunate enough to bump into anyone to snap me out of it this time around.
Oh well.
I’m sure I’ll find someone sooner or later.
I find something.
It’s not something I understand at first glimpse...nor is it something I understand after several more glimpses.
But it appears to be some sort of sanctuary.
Did I say sanctuary?
I meant to say {s}restaurant{/s} sanctuary.
I give up on whatever it is I want to say and direct my full attention to discerning the structure before me-
But the lingering scent of pork broth and what I think is fried chicken invades my nostrils and forces me into a state of mild confusion in which I can’t even fully recall how I wound up here.
I attempt to approach the building, but my legs stiffen up.
And then, something extraordinary happens.
Hear ye, hear ye.
We, the council of plants, have called upon this meeting to discuss the probability of furthering the development of one-
Uhh...am I reading this correctly?
The name I have here is “Sensei Arakawa.”
We couldn’t figure out his full name, so we just put what all of the girls have been calling him.
Wasn’t it Steve? I could have sworn the tomboy one called him that recently.
Which tomboy? The one who rips her hair out? Or the one he hugged on the bridge that one time?
The first one, with the hair.
Wait, hold on. I just remembered I die in this event and I don't want to go through that again. It was horrible.
Order, order.

As exciting as it would be to sit here and discuss saving our dear brother's life, we must now take into consideration the fact that the beach trip is halfway over and barely anything has been accomplished.
Well, what exactly were we hoping to accomplish again? We’re just plants. It’s not like we can actually...you know, “further development” or whatever.
No, we certainly can not. But we can-
Woah woah woah. Wait a second. Isn’t that him right there?
Oh, shit.
What do we do?
Just...just stay quiet. It’s not like he can hear us or anything.
Hello.
Did he just fucking say, “Hello?”
He totally just said, “Hello.”
Why are all of you plants talking about me?
Umm, better question. Who’s a better hugger? Makoto or Chika?
Chika 100%%. Makoto’s a little tramp, remember?
Dude, no. Not in this version she's not.
Yeah! Sensei is the huggy boy now! Everyone is safe until they're not!
This is exactly what the narrator was talking about in “Something Everyone Knows and Ignores.”
Ughhhhhhh please no. That fucking alphabet song {i}just{/i} stopped being stuck in my head.
A! Apple!
B! Banana!
Order, order!
Can someone please explain to me where we are right now? Or...why you guys can talk?
Uhh...how should we put this-
It’s all a hallucination, isn’t it?
A hallucination?
Uhhh yeah! None of this is actually happening right now! You’re just dreaming!
Buuuuut if this {i}wasn’t{/i} a dream, you’d find yourself standing at a ramen shop at the edge of the world!
No, idiot. The edge of the world is the roof. Do you even fucking read the events?
No petition necessary.
Wait! No! I can’t get kicked out! I have saplings to feed!
Sorry, man. That’s just the way the chrysanthemum crumbles.
That’s not even a plant! It’s a flower!
Plants, flowers, what’s the difference?
A lot! For starters, plants-
The cactus turns into a skull and the meeting adjourns.
Good fucking riddance. I bet that guy wasn’t even a Plantreon supporter.
He was. I bumped into his wife at Whole Foods a few weeks ago and we talked about it for a little while.
Really nice family. I’m actually feeling kind of bad now.
Petition denied.
Asshole.
Can someone please tell me what’s going on?
Dude, just go into the shop. You weren’t even supposed to stop and talk to us.
I mean, it’s not every day I bump into a group of inanimate objects having a conversation with one another.
Let alone a conversation about “furthering my development.”
Ugh, great. Now I have to file an I-35 and explain to the {i}Supreme{/i} Plant Council why there was another deviation.
There sure have been a lot of those lately...Do you think it’s something we should worry about?
I’m sure it’s fine. It’s just his memories trying to come back or whatever, isn't it?
Whatever it is, it won’t do us any good to continue discussing it while he’s right there listening.
Anyway! This concludes the ninety-seventh gathering of District 23’s Plant Council!
Please remember to keep everything discussed here classified from any and all interested parties, and feel free to help yourself to a croissant on the way out.
Croissants are for girls.
Hah. I get it.
I stare blankly at a set of chairs before me.
There is a skull on one of them.
I feel like I’m forgetting something.
I walk into the strange building to be met with the surprising sight of one girl I’ve hugged and one girl I’m going to hug.
Their names are Makoto and Touka and they are both relatively unpopular, each for different reasons.
But I’m glad to see that they’ve found company in one another.
Hey, you two. How are things?
What do you mean, “How are things?” What is wrong with you?
I’m sorry?
Sensei...you’ve been standing there looking...lost for a fair amount of time now.
And let’s not gloss over the fact that you played out an entire plant-based roleplay scenario of sorts.
Did Noriko give you another potion? Because I explicitly told her to not do that.
Plant...roleplay?
There was a fatality and everything. It was actually rather touching in a...very strange sort of way.
Nevermind that. Would one of you mind telling me where exactly we are right now?
Oh, this old place?
It’s just an extra restaurant my family had lying around.
I informed my father that there weren’t many options for us to choose from for dinner, so he had this one airlifted over.
I envy the sort of life that leads to you having “extra” restaurants lying around.
I actually quite like this one despite its rather drab decor and strange scent.
It’s not really strange. That’s just kind of...how ramen smells.
Is that so?
I don’t typically eat things this inexpensive, so I was unaware it was commonplace.
So you two are just...hanging out at a secret ramen shop Touka’s family had airlifted in the middle of the night?
That’s not all, Sensei. Makoto was actually helping me study.
Study? You {i}do{/i} realize we’re on vacation, right?
Neither of us had anything else to do, so...
I also find learning to be quite fun! And since swimming is out of the question given the weather, it only made sense for us to seize this opportunity to get something done.
Wow. If only someone who cared a little less about studying would show up right about now...
Woah...
What...is this place?...
A hidden audience erupts into applause as Chika finds her way into the secret Tsukioka ramen shop at the edge of the world that isn’t actually the edge of the world maybe.
Oh, Chika! You showed up after all.
I’m assuming this is where our study-session concludes then?
Oh, don’t be silly. I’m sure Chika also sees the value in utilizing free time to become a better, more knowledgeable, person.
Isn’t that right, Chika?
Chika? Hello?
Hey.
Oh! Hey!
I didn’t realize you were here too, Sensei.
Don’t worry, even I didn’t realize I was here until a few minutes ago.
Oh, you. You’re so funny. No wonder you and I are-
Two people with a totally normal relationship not worth mentioning to anyone else?
Chika’s clothes reform into a clown costume and I do a little jig to celebrate.
A fish stares up at me from the ground outside of the restaurant, gasping for breath but incapable of breathing because...uhh, water.
I don’t know the sciencey explanation for it.
It’s reverse drowning.
Makoto, can you explain what the fish is doing?
Fish? What fish?
Could he be referring to one of our bowls of cheap commoner noodles?
I could stand here and stare at you for the rest of eternity and not regret even a second of it.
But what about Chinami?
Hm? What’s this about Chinami?
Yumi?
Uhhhhhh yup. That’s my name, asshole.
What are you doing here?
I work here, asshole.
Since when?
Since you helped me get a job here. Remember, asshole?
I don’t remember that at all.
Really? You don’t remember the entire arc about my mom and me reconnecting? And me discovering that I’m a product of her being knocked up while unconscious, asshole?
Do you even pay any attention to me at all, asshole?
Or are you just here to kill the pain, asshole?
Pain?
What pain?
Senseiiiiiiii~ Look at meeeeeeee~
No.
Hey, asshole.
Do you remember all of those detentions you used to give me back before you regained your own body (If that is what is actually happening here), asshole?
I don’t.
I don’t remember anything from before the first time I “woke up” in[school] again.
There was something you said to me during one of those that really stuck with me, asshole.
And what was that?
That I was wasting my potential, asshole.
And that stuck with you?
Yeah. But not in a good way, asshole.
Because, from my perspective, there was never any potential there, asshole.
I’ve been nothing but an abomination of failures stitched together since the moment I popped out of my junkie mom, asshole.
And having some guy who knows nothing about me pretend to know my potential was even worse than the time you [[redacted].
Asshole.
I missed you.
...Maya?
Maya?
Is everything okay, Sensei?
You’ve been standing there looking...lost for a fair amount of time now.
Wait, has...Chika been here? Or Yumi?
Neither of those two have been-
Woah...
What...
What is this place?
Oh, this is where you were? I’ve been looking all over for you.
Why haven’t you been answering your phone?
My phone?
I slide my phone out of my pocket to find that I have several missed calls and an entire string of text messages from Chika spanning over the course of the last three hours.
How did...
How did you know she would be here?
Is there an emergency or something?
No, I...
I just...you know...
Whatever brought you here, Chika, I do implore you to sit down and try these lower middle class ramen noodles! They are absolutely splendid!
Oh! Thank you!
I was starting to think I wouldn’t be having dinner at all tonight.
Do you think it’d be okay if I packed some up for Yumi as well? Girl didn’t even eat breakfast today.
I take a seat at the counter and order from one of the Tsukioka family servants or...employees or something.
He doesn’t speak at all, but he nods after I place my order and brings me a fresh bowl of soup just minutes later.
Before I know it, the girls and I are choking down piping hot lower middle class ramen noodles.
They’re good.
Not Tojo Ramen good, but still good.
I think mine had cactus in it.
We leave the secret ramen shop and Makoto and Touka proceed to have some sort of formal, smart person conversation that I can’t be bothered to pay attention to.
Instead, I focus my gaze on stars sinking into the sea and find myself getting lost in a sea of my own.
Not of water, but of skepticism and a heavy dose of regret.
Not the type of regret that results from making a poor decision, but the kind that comes from feeling like you’ve wasted too much time.
But that shouldn’t be an issue for me.
I have as much time as the world can offer.
But still-
I feel like yet another chunk of my life has been ripped away from me.
Or out of me.
Something is missing.
Sensei?
Yeah?
You okay?
I’m fine. Why do you ask?
Obviously cause you look...not okay.
Whatever it is will pass. I’m probably just tired.
Long day?
Yes and no.
Mostly yes, I think.
Anything I can do to make you feel better?
A hug would be nice.
I see, I see.
Come with me then.
Come with you where?
I don’t know. Just come.
But-
They’re talking about smart person stuff. They won’t even realize we’re gone.
I’m pretty sure they’ll still realize if-
Shush.
On the count of three, we turn around and start walking toward the woods.
Chika...
One...
Two...
Three.
Wait, where did Sensei and Chika go? Weren’t they just here?
I believe so...but I don’t recall them ever leaving.
Perhaps they forgot something at my spare restaurant?
Perhaps.
Let’s just head back to the inn, I guess...
